title: The Sinner
description: A prostitute battles the parents of her baby's father--a derelict--for custody of the child.

title: Age of Consent
description: Brock tries to help a young man when his girlfriend's father tries to break up their relationship by dragging the youngster into court.

title: You Can't Beat the System
description: Brock tries to help a Korean War veteran suffering from post-traumatic distress.

title: Something for the Girls
description: A wealthy young socialite, sentenced to community service due to a string of unpaid parking tickets, is assigned to do paperwork in Neil's office. She starts to lose some of her "superior" attitude when some of the neighborhood girls start coming to her for tips on how to keep their boyfriends.

title: I Before E Except After C
description: Brock and a committed teacher try to convince young Puerto Rican dropouts to go back to school by coming up with a progressive education program.

title: No Wings at All
description: The struggles of a couple trying to cope with an adult son who is mentally retarded.

title: Who Do You Kill?
description: A young African-American couple battle economic and social woes. Joe can only find menial jobs and to make ends meet Ruth works in a cheap bar. Then tragedy strikes their child.

title: No Hiding Place
description: An upwardly mobile black family moves into a previously all-white neighborhood in suburban Long Island, New York. Chuck and Anne Severson, who are Neil's friends, at first welcome them to the neighborhood, even though some of their friends and neighbors don't want the black family there. However, when local real estate agents start "blockbusting"--the practice of scaring white homeowners into selling their homes for less than they're worth by raising the prospect of more blacks moving into the neighborhood and lowering property values, then selling the homes at vastly inflated prices to those same black families--Chuck and Anne must decide whether their stand against racism is worth losing the investment they have in their home.

title: Where's Harry
description: A Jewish businessman who can't put up with the vapid suburban life anymore goes back to the city tenement he grew up in, only to find that it's now occupied by a young black family.

title: Creeps Live Here
description: Neil's office tries to help a lonely old woman whose house is scheduled to be demolished by the city.

title: The $5.98 Dress
description: A woman who's on welfare can't support her family with the money she gets, so she takes a job to earn more money. When the welfare department finds out about it, she's thrown in jail.

title: The Beatnik and the Politician
description: Brock comes to the aid of a group of "beatniks" in Greenwich Village who are trying to fight a crooked political boss and find themselves at odds with their Italian neighbors.

title: One Drink at a Time
description: Two homeless people have a falling out one of them begins binge drinking wood alcohol.

title: It's War, Man
description: A killer in a teenage street gang is arrested and starts on his way through the juvenile justice system.

title: Don't Grow Old
description: An aging construction worker becomes resentful when he's forced into retirement before he's ready.

title: The Street
description: After her mother's boyfriend abuses her, a teenager runs away from home and tries to survive on the streets.

roles.char: First woman in the dressing room
Second Woman in the Dressing Room
Third Woman in the Dressing Room

title: If Your Grandmother Had Wheels
description: Neil tries to help a wheelchair-bound man who focuses all of his dreams on walking again.

title: The Passion of the Nickel Player
description: Neil comes into conflict with a numbers runner who preys on his neighborhoods poor gamblers.

title: Take Sides with the Sun
description: Neil must decide whether he can help more people performing community service work or as a legislative consultant to a U.S. Congressman.

title: The Name of the Game
description: An old-time union leader is eager to go against a corporate executive he has battled in the past, but it seems that he'd rather fight than come to a compromise that would benefit all sides.

title: Nothing But the Half Truth
description: Neil considers quitting when Congressman Hanson doesn't follow through on promises made during a television show.

title: The Givers
description: Brock and Hanson lobby for their proposed legislation which would stiffen penalties for contracting fraud, but their efforts are opposed by well-placed manufacturers with plenty of cash.

title: Here Today
description: Brock writes a long series of articles about the plight of the urban poor, but no newspaper or magazine will publish them.
